p: H6N1 viruses (A/chicken/Taiwan/0702/2013) were propagated in 10-day-old embryonated specific-pathogen-free (SPF) chicken eggs for 72 h at 37°C. Madin–Darby canine kidney (MDCK) cells, chicken DF-1 cells, human A549 cells, human embryonic kidney HEK293T cells, and duck embryo (DE) cells were maintained in Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium (DMEM, Gibco BRL, Life Technologies Corporation, Carlsbad, CA, United States) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS; HyClone, Logan, UT, United States) and antibiotics.
